meanings.definition: A mathematical function that maps between categories.
meanings.sent1: Functors help us understand how things relate in math.
meanings.sent2: In category theory, functors are essential for connecting different categories.
meanings.sent3: The functors at the math party were busy mapping out relationships.
meanings.sent4: She saw the world through the lens of functors, connecting everything in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The concept of functors is like a bridge that links different mathematical worlds.

meanings.definition: An object in category theory that can be used to represent a mapping between categories.
meanings.sent1: Category theory uses functors to show how categories are linked.
meanings.sent2: The functor in this theory acts as a translator between categories.
meanings.sent3: The playful functor jumped from one category to another, making connections along the way.
meanings.sent4: His mind worked like a functor, smoothly translating ideas from one category to another.
meanings.sent5: The functor was like a versatile tool, fitting perfectly between different categories.
